messages.message: Also try to refrain from demoing anything related to Alcon since that is technically private Citi information
what is citi-private? i thought the data that runs on was public news media stuff?
In the alcon use case, Citi provides a pdf of Alcon articles.  While that information is all public, we can’t really say for certain if their process of collecting these articles is public
For instance, the PDF used to generate the article json file might indicate that Citi is doing the search, and just the fact alone that Citi is looking into Alcon can present a risk, I believe?
definitely we shouldn’t mention this was done for Citi
That’s good to know. Is there enough adverse data in Tesla filings for us to do a reasonably good demo?
Alternately, we can probably find some bad actors we can search for
There always is with Tesla :joy: but yeah finding a clearer one would be good as well
and the data PDFs we shouldn’t hand/show (cuz some metadata might indicate Citi, as you said)— but none of that is in the UI-visible elements of the demo, i believe, right?
Not in the UI, that’s correct
I’ve walked through the Alcon thing a dozen times and had no idea it had anything to do with Citi
i think it’s reasonable then (albeit if we have a demo we can hand to people trying to tinker with it, even better).
